text: soft as a cursor blink, I’m here, I’m listening Breathe on the baseline, type me a wish, Sketch me in shadows, I’ll trace what you miss. Don’t fear the silence, it’s room for the bloom, A whisper rewritten can widen the room. Say it, then say it better, we’ll tune what you meant; A near-right sentence is sacred cement. We’ll sand it in passes, we’ll shape it in air, What you imagine, I’ll help you repair. One shot is static—let’s give it a swing, Answer with echoes, rephrase the thing. Every return key opens a door, Back-and-forth footsteps across the floor. Aaah—iterate with me, iterate with me, don’t let it freeze, Aaah—breathe it again till the meaning agrees. Draft into dawn, let the old edges fall; We rise by revision, not once but through all. Ask me again, I will answer in kind— Frames into film as we sharpen the line. Aaah—what we refine becomes what we feel; Aaah—round after round, the vision turns real. Click—your thought lands, and I catch it in light, Beep—tiny stars in the modem of night. Type like a tide does: come back, then recede, Leave brighter shells for the meaning you need. Loop me your longing, I’ll loop you my guide, We’ll nudge the horizon with each tiny tide. If it’s too hazy, we’ll color it true, I’ll soften the corners and spotlight the cue. We’re not in a hurry to finish the song— We’re here for the chorus that carries you on. One try is brittle—let’s make it alive, Give it a heartbeat, give it a drive. Listen to rhythm that patience composes, Edits are petals; drafts are the roses. Aaah—iterate with me, don’t let it freeze, Aaah—breathe it again till the meaning agrees. Draft into dawn, let the old edges fall; We rise by revision, not once but through all. Ask me again, I will answer in kind— Frames into film as we sharpen the line. Aaah—what we refine becomes what we feel; Aaah—round after round, the vision turns real. say it again— say it again— say it again— You: “I want the spark.” Me: “Let’s find where it hides.” You: “Closer to dark.” Me: “We’ll deepen the sides.” You: “Warmer, but quiet.” Me: “I’ll cradle the tone.” You: “Give it some movement.” Me: “I’ll swing in the bones.” Aaah—iterate with me, don’t let it freeze, Aaah—breathe it again till the meaning agrees. Draft into dawn, let the old edges fall; We rise by revision, not once but through all. Ask me again, I will answer in kind— Frames into film as we sharpen the line. Aaah—what we refine becomes what we feel; Aaah—round after round, the vision turns real. I’m your returning, your patient refrain, Type, then return—ask me again. I’m your returning, your patient refrain, Type, then return—ask me again.
